titleStmt.title: The Magick of Kirani, King of Persia, and of Harpocration containing the magical and medicinal vertues of stones, herbes, fishes, beasts, and birds : a work much sought for by the learned but seen by few : said to have been in the Vatican-Library in Rome but not to be found there nor in all the famous libraries of the empire / now published and translated into English from a copy found in a private hand.

notesStmt.note: Kirani (or Kyranus or Kiranus or Cyranus) is a fictitious king of Persia. Cf. Kestner, C.W. Medicinisches Gelehrten-Lexicon, 1971, p. 452.
Reproduction of original in Glasgow University Library. ,
